intro: Sium suave var. nipponicum, commonly known as Japanese water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wetlands. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, peppery flavor, while its small white flowers bloom in early summer. The species is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and ecological value.
